summary: Constant exposure to idealized portrayals of others' lives can lead to feelings of envy and inadequacy, highlighting the dangers of comparing oneself to curated images.
Social media often presents an enhanced and misleading version of reality, where appearances can be deceiving due to staged or altered content.
Gaining insight into the deceptive nature of social media allows individuals to approach online content with skepticism, reducing the negative impact on self-esteem.
Shifting focus from online portrayals to real-life experiences fosters personal contentment and a more authentic sense of happiness.
